solution_line_template: If Sierra is currently {sierra_current_age} years old, {multiplier_for_age} times her age is {sierra_current_age}*{multiplier_for_age} = <<{sierra_current_age}*{multiplier_for_age}={ten_times_sierra_age}>>{ten_times_sierra_age}.
Twenty more than {multiplier_for_age} times Sierra's age is {ten_times_sierra_age}+{twenty_more} = {twenty_more_than_ten_times_sierra_age}

{twenty_more_than_ten_times_sierra_age} is {forty_less} less than ten times Diaz's age so {multiplier_for_age} times Diaz's age is {twenty_more_than_ten_times_sierra_age}+{forty_less} = {ten_times_diaz_age}
If ten times Diaz's age is {ten_times_diaz_age}, Diaz is {ten_times_diaz_age}/{multiplier_for_age} = <<{ten_times_diaz_age}/{multiplier_for_age}={diaz_current_age}>>{diaz_current_age} years old.
Twenty years from now, Diaz will be {years_from_now}+{diaz_current_age} = <<{years_from_now}+{diaz_current_age}={diaz_age_future}>>{diaz_age_future} years old.
